reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parador building is one of many fabulous renaissance jewels in Ubeda. We were on a 5 night card, and got a basic internal room which was very gloomy and small. Not only is parking a problem, but finding the Parador is problematic too, with virtually non-existant sigh-posting.
reviews.title: A mixed bag

reviews.text: The restaurant is just about ok, but you will almost certainly be using it given the remarkable dearth of restaurants [and bars] in Ubeda. It is something of a gastronomic desert .
reviews.title: beautiful location (however not parkingspace nor pool)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful location, however for this rate you would expect a parking (or reserved parkingplaces of guests).
reviews.title: Renaissance Charm and Grandeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were perfect, tv screen, decoration in style but with wifi working easily. Restaurant was a bit uptide but also good, breakfast expensive with cava but no fresh orange juice. Staff is very friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel in lovely location, shame about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ubeda is nice but for a short trip 9no longer than 1 day)
reviews.title: Wish we'd been warned it was a building site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving in Ubeda we worried about parking but the receptionist at the Parador pointed us in the right dirrection 5 mins from the hotel and free parking as well. The room was very pleasant and our first night being a Monday night we worried about getting food. The parador restaurant served us very nice food and a very friendly male waiter. The starter of Black Pudding was just awesome.
reviews.title: Breath Of Fresh air

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Parador at Ubeda is different from many Paradors in old palaces etc. in that although it's a 17th century building it is not as grand as some, despite its exposing facade. The inner courtyard (now roofed) is supported by surprisingly slender marble columns only 10" across, and none of the public spaces are "palatial." This makes it more like a "normal" hotel than many - neither good nor bad, just different. Rooms are on the ground and first floors with various aspects. We had ground floor side which opened out to an inner courtyard serving the bar and could have been noisy if people had been up late. I think first floor front would be good as the street outside seems pretty quiet at night. Our room was on two levels and perfectly comfortable. We had dinner in the restaurant (which again felt like a 'normal' restaurant) and it was OK - neither great nor poor. Buffet breakfast is also served here.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable and lovely

reviews.text: The central courtyard does not make such a great lounge area as in some other paradors partly because the faux-wicker chairs and tables are just parked around the flagstones, so it's quite bare. But also because quite a few people wander in off the street. When we arrived in fact the entire place was occupied by a party of tourists being lectured by a guide. It's better in the evening. There is an adjacent lounge for guests only but it is very gloomy.
reviews.title: Historical Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can park outside to unload, then there is free parking a few minutes walk away.
reviews.title: In the Heart of Old Ubeda
Loved the building and patio/hated the room
reviews.text: Overall we were happy enough to spend two nights here as a base to explore Ubeda. Going back I might look for somewhere else, but I suspect when I check the prices of the new five star hotel being opened in a restored palace I will stick with the Parador!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a parking possibility on the one way lane just after the police station authorized for guests to load and unload (I missed and made another round). The public parking is just about 400 m straight ahead, there was a parking lot, but this is low season. Anyhow, once you've carried your luggage over the plaza to the hotel reception, onwards to the room we got help. The hotel, the former Palacio de Deán Ortega), is the dominant building of the plaza beside the impressing El Salvador church (must visit), and the palacio initially makes kind of gloomy but powerful look, due to the small and barred windows on the first floor making it look somewhat like a prison (but that was the style of the time), but as soon as you enter the patio (now covered by glass roof), it immediately feels more friendly. The building is also a kind of museum, so the public (e.g. school classes on excursion) enter to look around, though that did not really disturb, as the private parts of the building are reserved for the guests (called clients). We had booked a "special room", and so it was that we had a huge room (at least 4 m height) with direct access to a private andalusian garden with a typical fountain in the middle. Given the location in the centre of the town, this was very relaxing and in the morning you wake up by the chirping of countless birds. We had an outstanding dinner at the restaurant at a low price (25Euro) with 10 tapas as starter! Breakfast was equally good, specially the fried eggs made to order were excellent, also due to the local olive oil used. The second evening we had a tasty snack at the bar in the basement, which is quite pleasant while the television at the bar showed a football match (a Copa Real classico). Something to mention is that weather was quite cold, on third day even some sleet, but the heating of the room was efficient and very quiet. Also to mention is that the staff is overall friendly and helpful. All in all, with the surrounding historical town of Ubeda with its architectural jewels, an unforgettable experience.
reviews.title: Authentic Impressions of History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect old hotel. Ubeda is a very romantic city. the perfect getaway for for a romtantic weekend. Also a few very got places to go for good food.
reviews.title: Perfect little hotel in a very nice city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely place steeped in history. Ubeda itself is a lovely old Spanish town set high up in mountains. Stunning views. We used late rooms to book. Be careful as we inadvertently booked special deal for 20 to35 year olds. My wife was quite put back that she appeared older....she is! Deals for the 55years upwards were more expensive which I thought quite strange. Get a room overlooking the garden or court yard. 4 poster beds available as well. Great rooms. Really good stay
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully kept hotel with professional, friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is perfectly located in historic quarter close to many of the local attractions.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it has no car park there is a drop off point in front of the hotel and ample free parking within a couple of hundred metres.
reviews.title: Nice parador, unfortunately not that well managed

reviews.text: Not easy to find first time by car as signs are poor , very easy once sorted .
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel , great position a little expensive but worth it .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ubeda is a wonderful small city worth a visit. The Parador was beautiful with a great location and a fine restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic Parador Palace great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great parador building with excellent, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice sized room (126) on first floorwith internal balcony.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Food good although only 6 people dined in the evening so little ambience.
reviews.title: Beautiful , clean, and friendly staff
